intro: Thibaudia mundula, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are opposite on the stems. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, creating a visually appealing display. Thibaudia mundula is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
